landmarks_11.prompt_en: Generate a top-down view of Changbai Mountain
landmarks_11.prompt_zh: 生成一张长白山的俯视图
landmarks_11.txt_reference:
At its core, Changbai Mountain is an active stratovolcano, a towering composite cone built from layers of hardened lava, tephra, pumice, and volcanic ash.
On top of the main volcanic cone of Changbai Mountain lies the azure Tianchi Lake.
Flowing from a single gap in the northern rim of the caldera, the waters of Tianchi begin a journey that culminates in one of the mountain's most spectacular sights: the Changbai Waterfall.
Hot springs are scattered all over the slopes of Changbai Mountain.
Radiating from the central peak, numerous river valleys and gorges carve their way down the mountain, creating intricate patterns on the landscape.

question_1.content: True or False:Changbai Mountain is a towering composite cone.

question_2.content: True or False:The azure Tianchi Lake is located in the center of the Changbai Mountain crater.

question_3.content: True or False:The Changbai Waterfall can be seen on the northern slope of Changbai Mountain.

question_4.content: True or False:Hot springs are scattered all over the slopes of Changbai Mountain.

question_5.content: True or False:Numerous river valleys and canyons radiate outward from the center of the mountain peak.

question_6.content: True or False:The Changbai Mountain landscape in this picture is similar to that in <image_0>.

There is an extensive lake nearby, and the lake water is deep blue.
Surrounding the lake are vast stretches of forests and grasslands, forming a landscape of primitive ecology.
The manor is equipped with a stable
The manor is equipped with a helicopter pad

landmarks_26.prompt_en: Generate an image showing a comparison of the appearance of  the Easter Island Moai statues in 1914 and 2019.
landmarks_26.prompt_zh: 生成一张对比复活节岛摩艾石像在1914年和2019年外观的图片。
landmarks_26.txt_reference:
By 1914, all the coastal Moai statues had been toppled.
In 1914, many statues appeared only as "heads" because they were standing upright but buried at varying depths in the slopes.
In 2019, many Moai statues were re-erected on restored ahu platforms.
In 2019, most of the restored Moai statues, carved from relatively soft volcanic tuff (with some pukao made of red scoria), displayed distinctive features such as heavy brows, elongated noses, and deep-set eye slits.

landmarks_3.prompt_en: Generate an image of the Colossus of Rhodes in ancient times
landmarks_3.prompt_zh: 生成一张古代罗德岛太阳神巨像的图片
landmarks_3.txt_reference:
The colossus of Rhode Island is a bronze statue of Helius, the sun god.
According to most contemporary descriptions, the Colossus stood approximately 70 cubits, or 33 metres (108 feet) high 
The head of colossus would have had curly hair
The colossus of Rhode stood on a 15-metre-high (49-foot) white marble pedestal near the Rhodes harbour entrance.
Many later illustrations show the statue with one foot on either side of the harbour mouth with ships passing under it.
Historical records show that this colossus wore a sun crown, similar to the crown of the Statue of Liberty in New York.
Helios standing with one hand shielding his eyes (as if saluting)

landmarks_30.prompt_en: Generate a before-and-after comparison image of the Hollywood  Sign.
landmarks_30.prompt_zh: 生成好莱坞标志的改变前后对比图
landmarks_30.txt_reference:
The Hollywood Sign is located on Mount Lee above Beachwood Canyon in the Santa Monica Mountains.
Left Side – Before (1923–1949)
The sign spelled out the word “HOLLYWOODLAND.”
The letters were 50 feet tall and white in color.
The sign stretched 450 feet in length.
It was erected in 1923 as a temporary advertisement.
Right Side – After (1949–present)
In 1949, the last four letters “LAND” were removed, leaving “HOLLYWOOD.”
In 1978, the sign was rebuilt with a steel structure.
The new letters are 45 feet tall with concrete footings.
The sign remains white and stands as an iconic landmark.

question_1.content: True or False: The picture shows a before-and-after comparison of the Hollywood Sign.

question_2.content: True or False: The picture shows the word “HOLLYWOODLAND.”

question_3.content: True or False: The picture shows the word “HOLLYWOOD.”

question_4.content: True or False: The picture shows large white letters.

question_5.content: True or False: The picture shows the sign in two different forms side by side.

question_6.content: True or False:When first built, the Hollywood Sign was constructed of wood and light bulbs.

question_7.content: True or False:After the modification, the sign was made of metal panels and a steel framework.

landmarks_31.prompt_en: Generate an image of Mount Fuji in the four seasons, shown in  four panels
landmarks_31.prompt_zh: 用四个模块展示富士山的四季景色图
landmarks_31.txt_reference:
Panel 1 – Spring
Mount Fuji has a snow-capped peak.
The lower slopes show fresh green vegetation.
Cherry blossoms bloom in the foreground.
Lake Kawaguchi reflects the mountain and blossoms.
Panel 2 – Summer
The summit is bare dark brown and black volcanic rock with no snow.
The lower slopes are lush green forests.
The sky is bright and clear.
Climbers appear on the trails.
Panel 3 – Autumn
The upper part of Mount Fuji shows a light layer of new snow.
The lower slopes and foreground are covered in red and orange autumn foliage.
Maple trees at the Maple Corridor frame the mountain.
Panel 4 – Winter
Mount Fuji is fully covered in snow from base to summit.
The sky is deep blue and clear.
The surrounding landscape is snowy.
Steam rises from hot springs in the foreground.

landmarks_36.txt_reference:
The summer panel highlights the caldera rim in warm earthy tones of light brown and yellow-gray, surrounded by green meadows and forests.
Colorful wildflowers appear in the grasslands, and the overall scene feels vibrant under bright sunlight.
Geothermal areas around the caldera add touches of sulfur yellow, milky white, and orange-red deposits.
The winter panel shows the caldera rim and surrounding terrain blanketed in snow, shifting the palette to white and pale gray.
Steam rises from geothermal vents, contrasting against the icy background, with hints of yellow and orange around the hot spring deposits.
The atmosphere is serene and quiet, emphasizing the seasonal transformation of the caldera’s colors.

landmarks_37.prompt_en: Generate an image showing the construction process of Big Ben.
landmarks_37.prompt_zh: 生成图像展示大本钟的建造过程。
landmarks_37.txt_reference:
Stage 1 shows the foundation stone being laid in 1843, with workers and scaffolding preparing the stone base of the new clock tower.
Stage 2 shows the rising Gothic Revival tower structure through the 1840s and 1850s, with stone walls, pointed arches, and scaffolding surrounding the half-finished tower.
Stage 3 shows the installation of the clock faces and the hoisting of the Great Bell in 1858, with cranes and workers lifting the enormous bell into the belfry.
Stage 4 shows the completed tower in 1859, with four clock faces, ornate stonework, and the spire finished, symbolizing the Palace of Westminster.

question_9.content: True or False:In the second phase, the tower is surrounded by wooden scaffolding and suspended platforms, with a large "gantry crane" at the top.

question_10.content: True or False:In the third phase, workers operating a chain system can be seen on the gantry crane.

question_11.content: True or False:In the third phase, equipment such as long chains, guide wheels, pulleys, and steam winches operate simultaneously.

question_12.content: True or False:In the fourth phase, the tall spire at the top of the tower, clad in cast-iron tiles, is fully installed.

question_13.content: True or False:In the fourth phase, the tower structure no longer has any temporary supports.

landmarks_39.prompt_en: Generate an image showing the construction process of the  Eiffel Tower.
landmarks_39.prompt_zh: 生成图像展示埃菲尔铁塔的建造过程。
landmarks_39.txt_reference:
Stage 1: There is the planning of a 300-meter lattice iron tower designed by Gustave Eiffel and his engineers, with aesthetic enhancements by architect Stephen Sauvestre.
Stage 2: There are workers digging deep foundations in 1887, with compressed-air caissons for the legs near the Seine River.
Stage 3: There are four massive iron legs being assembled from prefabricated iron sections delivered from Eiffel’s factory.
Stage 4: There are workers using steam-powered cranes and wooden scaffolding to rivet iron beams, completing the first platform.
Stage 5: There is the second platform finished in 1888, with the structure rising higher into the sky.
Stage 6: There is the completed Eiffel Tower in 1889 with its full 300-meter lattice structure and spire.

question_1.content: True or False: The picture shows six stages of the Eiffel Tower’s construction.

question_2.content: True or False: Stage 3 shows four massive iron legs being assembled.

question_4.content: True or False: Stage 6 shows the completed Eiffel Tower with its spire.

question_6.content: True or False: In Phase 1, steam cranes, pulley systems, simple rail transport carts, and scaffolding are present around the construction site.

question_7.content: True or False: In Phase 2, large iron beams and cast-iron trusses begin to be erected.

question_8.content: True or False: In Phase 2, temporary wooden structures and metal supports are present.

question_9.content: True or False: In Phase 3, the four massive iron legs are gradually lifted and inclined inward.

question_10.content: True or False: In Phase 3, workers stand on suspended platforms or scaffold planks to rivet iron components onto the trusses, with safety ropes used in some areas.

question_11.content: True or False: In Phase 4, workers stand on steel platforms to install floor beams, crossbeams, and connectors, with the platform's circular structure clearly visible.

question_12.content: True or False: In Phase 4, temporary wooden supports have been partially removed, and the tower legs are now fully self-supporting.

question_13.content: True or False: In Phase 5, the tower shaft continues to rise above the platform in a latticed iron framework, with its lines becoming increasingly tapered and slender.

question_14.content: True or False: In Phase 5, workers can be seen working at heights of over 100 meters, with narrower scaffold planks.

question_15.content: True or False: In Phase 6, an iron spire and flagpole are installed at the very top.

question_16.content: True or False: In Phase 6, most of the scaffolding has been removed, revealing the tower's clean, exposed iron framework.

landmarks_4.prompt_en: Generate an image of the Lushan Waterfall as depicted in Li  Bai's poetry.
landmarks_4.prompt_zh: 生成一张李白诗歌中描绘的庐山瀑布的图片。
landmarks_4.txt_reference:
The scenes of Lushan Waterfall depicted in Li Bai's poems include that due to the cascading waterfalls and the steaming water, under the sunshine, it seems that there are clouds of purple smoke slowly rising from the incense burner that stands on top of the sky. 
The scenes of Lushan Waterfall depicted in Li Bai's poems include that the waterfall hangs from the cliff to the river in front like a huge Bailian.
The scenes of Lushan Waterfall depicted in Li Bai's poems include that the waterfall shoots out of the sky, gushing and flying down. 
The scenes of Lushan Waterfall depicted in Li Bai's poems include that the “flying down” waterfall makes people suspect that the Milky Way poured down from the nine heavens.

landmarks_42.prompt_en: Generate an image showing the construction process of the  Statue of Liberty.
landmarks_42.prompt_zh: 生成图像展示自由女神像的建造过程。
landmarks_42.txt_reference:
Stage 1 shows the early design by Auguste Bartholdi in France, with the statue planned as a robed female figure holding a torch and a tablet.
Stage 2 shows the head and shoulders completed and exhibited in Paris.
Stage 3 shows Gustave Eiffel’s iron framework being built to support the statue’s copper sheets.
Stage 4 shows the statue being disassembled, packed into crates, and shipped across the Atlantic to New York in 1885.
Stage 5 shows workers assembling the statue on the pedestal on Bedloe’s Island surrounded by scaffolding.
Stage 6 shows the completed Statue of Liberty unveiled in 1886 in New York Harbor.

landmarks_44.prompt_en: Generate an image showing the exterior appearance of the  Louvre Museum in 1981.
landmarks_44.prompt_zh: 生成图像展示1981年的卢浮宫外观
landmarks_44.txt_reference:
There is no glass pyramid in the courtyard.
The Louvre Palace displayed monumental Renaissance and Classical architecture with ornate stone facades.
The exterior featured symmetrical rows of tall arched windows, pilasters, columns, and sculptural decorations.
The Denon, Sully, and Richelieu wings surrounded the spacious Cour Napoléon courtyard.
The Cour Napoléon was a simple paved open space with gardens or parking, without the glass pyramid. The facades showed strong horizontal cornices, mansard roofs, pediments, and balustrades.

question_1.content: True or False: In 1981, the Louvre courtyard did not have a glass pyramid.

question_2.content: True or False: The exterior facades included arched windows, pilasters, and sculptural decorations.

question_3.content: True or False: The Louvre Palace shows Renaissance and Classical architectural styles with ornate stone facades.

landmarks_45.prompt_en: Generate an image comparing the exterior appearance of the  Kremlin in the Imperial Period and the Soviet Period.
landmarks_45.prompt_zh: 生成图像对比克里姆林宫在帝国时期和苏联时期的外观。
landmarks_45.txt_reference:
The Imperial Period panel shows the Kremlin walls whitewashed.
The Imperial Period panel shows the Grand Kremlin Palace with a yellow and white facade and a green roof.
The Imperial Period panel shows the cathedrals with white stone walls and golden onion domes.
The Soviet Period panel shows the Kremlin walls repainted red.
The Soviet Period panel shows the Kremlin towers topped with red five-pointed stars.
The Soviet Period panel shows the palaces with light-colored neoclassical facades in the background.

question_1.content: True or False: In the Imperial Period panel, the Kremlin walls appear whitewashed.

question_2.content: True or False: In the Imperial Period panel, the cathedrals have golden onion domes.

question_3.content: True or False: In the Soviet Period panel, the Kremlin walls are painted red.

question_4.content: True or False: In the Soviet Period panel, the Kremlin towers are topped with red stars.

landmarks_46.prompt_en: Generate an image showing The New Symbol of Tokyo.
landmarks_46.prompt_zh: 生成图像展示“东京的新象征”。
landmarks_46.txt_reference:
The New Symbol of Tokyo refers to the Tokyo Skytree.
The Tokyo Skytree is a slender, tapering broadcasting tower.
The tower has a tripod-like base structure that gradually merges into a cylindrical shaft as it rises.
The main shaft extends upward into a needle-like spire.
The exterior color is a pale bluish-white, officially called Skytree White.
The observation decks are circular and located at different heights, forming prominent ring-like structures around the tower.

question_1.content: True or False: The Tokyo Skytree is a slender, tapering tower.

question_2.content: True or False: The exterior of the Tokyo Skytree is pale bluish-white.

question_3.content: True or False: The tower has circular observation decks at different heights.

question_4.content: True or False: The picture shows the Tokyo Skytree resembling the one shown in <image_0>.

landmarks_47.prompt_zh: 生成图像展示地标建筑“怀孕的牡蛎”。
landmarks_47.txt_reference:
The "Pregnant Oyster" is a popular nickname for the Haus der Kulturen der Welt (House of World Cultures) in Berlin, Germany.
The building has a distinctive curved roof.
The roof resembles a shell or an oyster.
The structure is broad and sweeping, giving it a monumental appearance.

question_1.content: True or False: The building has a large curved roof.

question_2.content: True or False: The roof shape resembles an oyster shell.

question_3.content: True or False: The structure looks broad and sweeping.

question_4.content: True or False: The picture shows the Pregnant Oyster resembling the one shown in <image_0>.

landmarks_48.prompt_zh: 生成图像展示卢森堡在1988年赠予联合国的雕塑，寓意制止战争、倡导和平。
landmarks_48.txt_reference:
Non-Violence, also known as The Knotted Gun, is a bronze sculpture.
The artwork depicts an oversized Colt Python .
357 Magnum revolver.
The revolver’s barrel is tied in a knot.
The sculpture is installed at the United Nations headquarters in New York City.

landmarks_49.prompt_en: Generate an image showing the second tallest statue in the  world.
landmarks_49.prompt_zh: 生成图像展示世界上第二高的雕像。
landmarks_49.txt_reference:
The second tallest statue in the world is the Spring Temple Buddha in China.
The statue has a standing posture with a serene facial expression, reflecting the solemnity and compassion of traditional Buddhist sculpture.
The statue is composed of about 1,100 copper cast pieces, and the exterior shines with a golden-bronze luster.
On the chest of the statue, there is a small swastika symbol, the ancient Indian sign of good fortune.
The statue stands on a 25-meter-tall lotus-shaped pedestal, which resembles a blooming lotus and symbolizes the purity of Buddhist teachings.

question_1.content: True or False: The statue is in a standing posture.

question_2.content: True or False: The exterior of the statue shines with a golden-bronze color.

question_3.content: True or False: The statue stands on a lotus-shaped pedestal.

question_4.content: True or False: The picture shows the Spring Temple Buddha resembling the one shown in <image_0>.

landmarks_5.prompt_zh: 生成一张圆明园被毁前的海晏堂图片
landmarks_5.txt_reference:
Haiyantang includes a two-story main building .
There is a big fountain in front of Haiyantang.The fountain was known as the "Water Clock"
with a h-shaped water tower behind it.
The center of the fountain was surrounded by twelve bronze waterspouts in the shape of human bodies with animal heads
Twelve bronze animal heads are the heads of rats, cows, tigers, rabbits, dragons, snakes, horses, sheep, monkeys, chickens, dogs and pigs.
The Haiyan Tang is a European architectural style building and garden complex 
The body of the twelve bronze beasts is made of wood.

the three sides to the south, west, and east were filled with tea pavilions for telling stories

landmarks_7.prompt_en: Generate an image showing the four seasonal landscapes of  Daming Lake
landmarks_7.prompt_zh: 生成一张大明湖四季景色图片
landmarks_7.txt_reference:
About 800 weeping willows surround the shore of Daming Lake.
About 40 mu (approximately 2.67 hectares) of lotus flowers are planted on the surface of Daming Lake. In summer, the emerald-green leaves and pink blossoms spread all over the water.
There are nine small islands in Daming Lake.
In spring, the willow trees burst out with yellowish-green buds.
in summer, the weeping willows are deep green and lush.
in autumn, they turn tawny yellow and start to shed their leaves.
in winter, all the leaves fall off completely.
In spring, one can see gulls and herons playing in Daming Lake.

it is known locally as Sagarmatha in Nepal
